sols_html:
We first apply the product rule to differentiate \(h(x)\):

\[\begin{aligned} h'(x) &= (f(x^2))' \cdot g(x) + f(x^2) \cdot g'(x) \\ &= {\color{OliveGreen} f'(x^2) \cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^2)} \cdot g(x) + f(x^2) \cdot g'(x) \\ &= f'(x^2) \cdot 2x \cdot g(x) + f(x^2) \cdot g'(x)\end{aligned}\]

Now we evaluate \(h'(-1)\):

\[\begin{aligned} h'(-1) &= f'((-1)^2) \cdot 2(-1) \cdot g(-1) + f((-1)^2) \cdot g'(-1) \\ &= -2 \cdot f'(1) \cdot g(-1) + f(1) \cdot g'(-1) \\ &= -2 \cdot (-2) \cdot 2 + (-1) \cdot 3 \\ &= {\color{blue} 5}\end{aligned}\]
